sentences.english: They are based on custom and are subject to change as new developments arise.
sentences.chinese: 会计惯例是基于习惯，并随着新发展的出现而心迹。

sentences.english: The vacant leaves thy mind's imprint will bear.
sentences.chinese: 你的心迹将这书的空页存管。

sentences.english: Open and aboveboard in their minds that he and the daughter of a deep love of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 表明他光明磊落的心迹和对典狱长女儿深深眷恋。

sentences.english: From your heart to your pen, take note of your learning substances.
sentences.chinese: 从心迹到笔迹，纪录你的学习质量。

sentences.english: But I doubt they would change their behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但是我对他们会心迹他们的行为持有怀疑态度。

sentences.english: This is being looked at old Xiang Jing, their minds a lot of things in their stride.
sentences.chinese: 看着这对祥静幸福的老人，心迹淡然了许多。

sentences.english: Heathcliff runs away Catherine accepts Edgar's proposal and pours out her heart to Ellen.
sentences.chinese: 凯瑟琳接受了埃德加的求婚并跟艾伦坦露心迹。

definition: to announce publicly/to explain oneself/to reveal one's feelings/to confess/to declare one's love
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
